page.title: 10DUDLESTON CHURCH
page.content: This church is very old with{Saxon origins.On the south side of the church is a{preaching cross.}Long ago,before the church was built,people used to{worship}there.The cross has worn away now but the shaft and steps remain.The stone is slowly crumbling away and moss is growing in the cracks. In the{churchyard}are several ancient {yew trees.}In one tree the bell was hung,whilst the tower was being rebuilt.The tree has an iron belt around it now because it's so old.In {1799,}there were{700 inhabitants}of {Dudleston,}now{only 45}remain.When we went into the church, we found a lot of interesting things.There was a solid{oak chest,}once used for keeping money and church valuables in.We saw a stone{font}and a beautiful carved {Jacobean}pulpit.
